I've loved the game ever since it came out. Although at this point: it's shit.

It's a good game. A lot of balances. You can tell the developers favour the survivors way too much in terms of balancing, BUT there are some balancing done in terms of addons, perks, items, abilities, etc.

But why is it shit? God awful matchmaking, disappointing and pathetic "dedicated" servers. Every single game I continuously lag and I end up paying the price. Hit registration for me has been completely fair, my problem being rubberbanding. Even if I stand still I move two paces behind, which can mean life and death in this game.

Truly disappointing for a ~3.5 Y/O game.

[strike] Eating sh*t in real life feels better than eating sh*t in this game, the amount of times that i've complained about something as broken as this game has made me want to kms. [/strike]
[b] 10/10 best game 2019 (no bugs) super fun [/b]

The game is really just a genuinely good pvp survival game. If you liked Friday the 13th, I can hardly recommend this enough. It's got a bit more depth to it, in my opinion, but first and foremost the different killers give each match an entirely different feel, and importantly, it does not let you know who you're up against before you encounter them, making you have to adapt your playstyle mid match.

Pros: Fun to be a survivor and killer.
Deep perk and progression system encourages mixing up both playstyles and leveling several killers and survivors.
Equippables can be taking into the game to give yourself a boost.
More consistent objectives than other games in the genere *cough cough* fucking car keys *cough cough*
More forgiving parameters for deaths, and the possibility of rescue.

Cons: Cash shop. Just... cash shop, as well as DLCs. I'm usually not a fan of any sort of microtransactions. DLC is a different story, killers and maps being added over time which aren't at a terrible price and personally- some of my favorites are in this later added DLC. That being said... some of my favorites are in DLC... which is not inherently a bad thing, you get your money's worth out of 5-6 buck packages of content, but I can see how it would nag at some who dislike the practice of DLC. The cash shop is also not *as* egregious as I've seen in most games, but I hesitate to give it a pass.

Some killers are just outright harder to play than others, which also isn't an inherently bad thing, but while some are straightforward, others are really difficult to play because of the amount of set up and time consuming things they must monitor. I'm looking at you trapper, you feel great when it works, but you suck when survivors pay enough attention to spot your bear traps.

As survivors, there is currently a not unsizable problem regarding a balance change that was made a while back. Secondary objectives exist in the game, things you could do to make it easier such as sabotage points in the map where the killer could potentially get you on a hook for the kill. It quickly became a meta strategy to take all breakable hooks out of the map before attempting the primary objective, which rightfully frustrated many killers and practically forced them to use a certain set of perks to have any hope of carrying survivors an inordinate distance to kill, wasting a shit ton of time. These hooks now regenerate, but such a nerf really makes sabotage useless as time spent in sabotage could easily be spent repairing generators to complete the game and, well, survive!

Certain killers excel on certain maps. That sounds pretty awesome, true, but for every good map for your choice of killer, there's one that will make you curse the RNG for giving you a crummy map.

Overall though, it's a great game and for only 20 bucks base, it's actually pretty reasonable to have DLC and a not-so-imposing cash shop (provided you have said DLC)
